alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 18 at 10:30PM EDT until April 24 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. .Recent snowmelt and rainfall will lead to elevated river levels. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt are occurring. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...From this evening to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, 5600 - cfs - Waterfront park areas near the M-69 bridge and low lying areas along the river in Crystal Falls become inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:10 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.4 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon at 100 PM CDT.
